name: Riparian vegetation or connectivity
functionStatement: Organic matter is captured and broken down, fueling food webs, balancing production/ respiration, moderating pH/ redox, and supplying nutrients.
descriptionMarkdown: Sufficient native vegetation width unless historically narrow (e.g., prairie streams).
howToMeasureMarkdown: Measure riparian corridor width and percent natural vegetation along the banks using land cover or riparian metrics. Field checks can be used to confirm major gaps.

levels.label: Optimal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: About 30 m of diverse native riparian vegetation, or consistent with reference corridor for the region.

levels.label: Poor
levels.criteriaMarkdown: <5 m corridor or little to no riparian vegetation.

references: EPA EnviroAtlas riparian metrics and/or NLCD.
